meanings.definition: A person who is opposed to snobbery.
meanings.sent1: She is known as an antisnobs because she believes everyone should be treated equally.
meanings.sent2: The antisnobs at the party made sure to include everyone in the conversation.
meanings.sent3: The antisnobs decided to organize a potluck to show that fancy dinners are not necessary for a good time.
meanings.sent4: Her actions spoke louder than words, proving she was the true antisnobs in the group.
meanings.sent5: The antisnobs wore simple clothes and refused to judge others based on their appearance.

meanings.definition: The attitude or behavior of being against snobbery.
meanings.sent1: His antisnobs was evident when he chose to spend time with people from all walks of life.
meanings.sent2: The antisnobs of the group helped create a welcoming and inclusive environment.
meanings.sent3: The antisnobs in her made her laugh at the idea of designer labels determining worth.
meanings.sent4: The room was filled with an air of antisnobs, where everyone was treated with respect.
meanings.sent5: The concept of antisnobs was ingrained in their family values, promoting kindness over status.
